meanings.def: a long, thin creature with a soft body and no bones or legs
examples: Worms burrow down through the soil.

meanings.def: long, thin creatures that live inside the bodies of humans or animals and can cause illness
the young form of an insect when it looks like a short worm
examples: This apple is full of worms.

meanings.def: a computer program that is a type of virus and that spreads across a network by copying itself
a person you do not like or respect, especially because they have a weak character and do not behave well towards other people
if you open up a can of worms, you start doing something that will cause a lot of problems and be very difficult
the person who takes the opportunity to do something before other people will have an advantage over them
a person who is normally quiet and does not complain will protest when the situation becomes too hard to bear

idioms.def: if you open up a can of worms, you start doing something that will cause a lot of problems and be very difficult

idioms.idiom: the early bird catches the worm
idioms.def: the person who takes the opportunity to do something before other people will have an advantage over them
a person who is normally quiet and does not complain will protest when the situation becomes too hard to bear

related: the early bird catches the worm

meanings.def: to use a twisting and turning movement, especially to move through a narrow or crowded place
examples: She wormed her way through the crowd to the reception desk.

meanings.def: to give an animal medicine that makes worms pass out of its body in the faeces
